title.narrative: Global investors for sustainable development GISD

description.narrative:
Det övergripande målet med denna insats är att öka volymen av långsiktiga investeringar för SDGarna.
Insatsen som helhet består av två huvuddelar: För det första, ett finansiellt bidrag till UN DESA för projektet "Launching the “Global Investors for Sustainable Development” (GISD) Alliance and developing a framework to map investments with the SDGs", och för det andra, metodologiska stöd och metodutveckling från Sida relaterat till att skapa och leda ett investerarnätverk.
UN DESAs projekt består av två delar:
Den första komponenten kommer att inrätta den nya "Global Investors for Sustainable Development" (GISD) alliansen, som kommer att inledas av FN: s generalsekreterare.
Den andra komponenten syftar till att utforska och skapa konsensus kring principer och normer som informerar utvecklingen av en ram för att mäta och rapportera om effekter av investeringar på SDGarna. Det skulle göras genom en omfattande översyn av befintliga ramar som kartlägger SDG investeringar ("SDG Impact Investments Measurement").
De två projektkomponenterna förstärker varandra på grund av deras komplementaritet och eventuella synergier.

The intervention as a whole comprises two main parts: firstly, a financial contribution to UN DESA for the project "Launching the "Global Investors for Sustainable Development" (GISD) Alliance and developing a framework to map investments with the SDGs", and secondly methodological support from Sida (metodutveckling) related to the creation and facilitation of an investor network.
The intervention by UN DESA comprises two components:
The first component will establish the new “Global Investors for Sustainable Development” (GISD) Alliance, which will be launched by the UN Secretary-General.
The second component aims to research and build consensus around principles and norms that would guide the development of a framework to measure and report on SDG impact of investments by conducting a comprehensive review of existing frameworks that map companies, securities and portfolio to the SDGs (“SDG Impact Investments Measurement”).
The two project components will reinforce other given their complementarity and possible synergies.

description.narrative:
In January 2020 GISD working groups started off with enthusism and engagement, following the positive spirit from the launch of GISD in October 2019 at the UN in New York with the Secretary General convening the meeting. A first stategy group meeting was held in Johannesburg on Feb 25-26th, resulting in new ambitions and plans. The very following week, the first week of March, the Corona-virus hit on a global scale and was upgrated to a pandemia, with lock-downs and severe effects on lives and health. For aprox. three weeks work of GISD was on hold as actors focused on internal issues. Then UNDESA managed to, among other things encouragement from Sida, re-engaging actors through 1, transforming the planned in person conference in Stockholm into a digital conference and meeting 2, invinting to an extraordinary meeting convened by the Secretary General 3, initiating a report on GISD-actors activities to step up and take responsability in the crisis and 4, intiating work on framework for Covid-19 bonds This re-engaged the actors. Planned work could continue through digital meetings and engagement even increased as the importance of finance in the crisis was acknowledged. However advancements on real investments where dealyed. The accomplishments during 2020 (please also refer to gisdalliance.org: Definition of Sustainable Development Investing A definition that actors in GISD have agreed on. Has been communicated to rating institutes, index providers, member states etc. Call for action on Covid-19 bonds and definition of use of proceeds around A framework for parties issuing Covid-19 bonds. Has been communicated to and through ICMA, Institutional Capital Market Association. Digital conference Buidling Back Better - development and finance leaders in joint action A three-hour event with broad participation and an audience of 9 000 viewers some two weeks after the event. Organized by Sida and UNDESA. Extraordinary meeting with the Secretary General and CEOs in June 2020 The SG gathered the CEOs to reinforce their importance in the Corona-crisis as them being part of the solution. CEOs encouraged for more blended finance in the crisis. Examples of how the GISD participants work in Covid-19 environment A report on the GISD members engagement and taken on actions in the crisis to support sustaianble developmetn was put together. Renewed, Recharged and Reinforced: Urgent actions to harmonize and scale sustainable finance. (64 recommendations on how to scale upp sustainable investing in a report to the European Commission in their stakeholder dialogue on EU taxonomy.) A substantial report on how GISD members recommends sustainable development to be advanced on a policy level, through transparency and corporate governance, among other things. Suggested Task team with World bank/GISD Sida has been introducing the idea of a special task team to encourage World Bank to better catalyse private investments. Has been discussed and elaborated with World Bank and the GISD group. Will be developped further in 2021 together with Canada. Typology of eligable SDG investments for professional investors One working group engaged in putting togheter a typology of the alternatives for investetments that are eligible for institutional investors, in order to kick off work to find the new architecture for sustainable investing. UNDP platform for investment needs in pilot countries GISD discovered possibilities to connect to UNDP's early work on pilots of investment opportunities and needs in developing countires. Dissusions on a digital platform to upload the mappings are continuing 2021. Investment opportunites related to GIF, Global Infrastucture Facility Early work on investment opportunity related to Global Infrastructure Facility, GIF - a platform connected to development bank portfolios convened by World bank. A new digital platform on the work was set up: www.gisdalliance.org In the end of the year a GISD platform was released. However there are still many dimensions to discover of how to communicate, upload initiatives etc on this. Investment actions have however not been realized due to Covid-19 crisis, but good momentum towards achieving them.
From the Sida perspective The following activities have been taken during 2020: Weekly calls with UNDESA on coaching, nudgeing, follow up, suggesting new dimensions, meetings etc. One internal strategy group meeting at Sida for GISD - taking advice from INTEM, Director General's staff and representative from Africa departent (early Feb 2020). Three formalized calls including with UNDESA Director for FSDO and Sida's head of Department and Unit on next steps, coaching in Convened meetings with SISD's GISD group and SISD's GISD reference group to make the connection between SISD's and GISD's work and engagement and to support the SISD representatives within GISD. Organized conference Building back better - finance and development leaders in joint action with high level representation from the World Bank, UN, IFC, GISD members, Swedish Ministers, Swedish Crown Princess. SISD etc. Discussions with World Bank on task force with GISD to catalyze private investments in line with the bank. Developed methods on how to work with financial actors from a development perspective. Internal exploratory work of possible guarantees connected to GISD initiatives. Participating actively in all working groups and strategy group. Reporting back to GS and supporting with speaking points, suggestions ahead of decisions on the way forward etc. Sida co-chair with PIMCO in one work steram - on new investment vehicles. Planning ahead and suggesting survey with Convergence on preferred investment alternatives with GISD. This survey will also discover also the over all sentiment on investing in low and middle income countries and preferred incentives to invest more in these countries.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
